posts.title: Fifty Shades of Hemingway
posts.text: Perhaps as much has been written about Hemingway as was written by him.

posts.title: Champagne Supernovas and Other Fun Fashion Reads
posts.text: While waiting between shows at Fashion Week, you might be in need of a good book. Champagne Supernovas: Kate Moss, Marc Jacobs, Alexander McQueen and the ‘90s Renegades Who Remade Fashion is reading for the runway.

posts.title: Ottendorfer Over the Years
posts.text: When the library first opened, its collections were half in German and half in English, and the purpose was to help German immigrants in the area assimilate and learn English. The Ottendorfer Library opened in 1885, a time when it was customary to have closed stacks in libraries. Much has changed in the East Village since the library first opened its doors.
